text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the concept of shared responsibility under the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 (FSO). It correctly identifies that both the owner (you) and the leaseholder are 'responsible persons' under Article 3. Crucially, it cites and explains the relevance of Article 5(3) (cooperation and coordination) and Article 22 (which deals with enforcement against multiple responsible persons, although the candidate focused more on the duties under 5(3) and the general liability framework). The analysis of liability hinges on the extent of control and the need for cooperation between the dutyholders, which directly satisfies the core requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "5a7e0773-5baa-4db9-ad30-8b52ad1d1305"}
